title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 302.1 - Purpose, scope, authority
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 302.1 - Purpose, scope, authority

State Regulations
(a) This

Part is established to control motor vehicle traffic and parking on State
property. The act of parking or driving a motor vehicle on such properties is a
privilege and constitutes acceptance by the owner and/or operator of such
vehicle of the responsibility to see that the vehicle is neither parked, stopped nor operated in violation of this Part or any of the provisions of the

New York State Vehicle and Traffic Law or any regulations thereunder
promulgated by the Department of Motor Vehicles. (b) This Part applies to the use, operation
and parking of all motor vehicles, as defined in section 125 of the New York

State Vehicle and Traffic Law, upon State property. (c) Orders of the Department of

Transportation heretofore or hereafter promulgated for the office shall
continue in full force and effect. The provisions of such orders are indicated, or will be indicated, by appropriate traffic and parking control lights, signs
or markings, or other devices. Violation of such orders will result in issuance
of simplified traffic informations or other citations. (d) All terms used herein that are defined in
article one of the Vehicle and Traffic Law shall have the same meanings for
purposes of this Part unless the context requires otherwise. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
302.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
